channel.title: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio

image.title: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio

channel.description: CBC Radio's Q is Canada's liveliest arts, culture and entertainment magazine. Q covers pop culture and high arts alike, with forays into the most provocative and compelling cultural trends. Q brings you big names, big ideas, and those paving the way in Canada's cultural community. Q is your cultural intervention!
channel.itunes:author: CBC Radio
channel.itunes:summary: CBC Radio's Q is Canada's liveliest arts, culture and entertainment magazine. Q covers pop culture and high arts alike, with forays into the most provocative and compelling cultural trends. Q brings you big names, big ideas, and those paving the way in Canada's cultural community. Q is your cultural intervention!

item.title: Patti Smith, k-os and DJ Skratch Bastid, journalist Mark Haskell Smith, Shirley Manson 01/01/15
item.description: Writer, poet, and musician Patti Smith on the power of daydream time. k-os and DJ Skratch Bastid switch it up in studio q. Journalist Mark Haskell Smith reveals the naked truth about nudism. Shirley Manson on 20 years of Garbage.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Writer, poet, and musician Patti Smith on the power of daydream time. k-os and DJ Skratch Bastid switch it up in studio q. Journalist Mark Haskell Smith reveals the naked truth about nudism. Shirley Manson on 20 years of Garbage.
item.itunes:summary: Writer, poet, and musician Patti Smith on the power of daydream time. k-os and DJ Skratch Bastid switch it up in studio q. Journalist Mark Haskell Smith reveals the naked truth about nudism. Shirley Manson on 20 years of Garbage.

item.title: Author Elizabeth Gilbert, comic Maysoon Zayid, chef Jamie Oliver 12/31/15
item.description: Eat Pray Love author Elizabeth Gilbert on the perils of ignoring your creative self. Pioneering comic Maysoon Zayid on defying convention and smashing stigma. British chef and activist Jamie Oliver challenges our mindless consumption of sugar.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Eat Pray Love author Elizabeth Gilbert on the perils of ignoring your creative self. Pioneering comic Maysoon Zayid on defying convention and smashing stigma. British chef and activist Jamie Oliver challenges our mindless consumption of sugar.

item.title: Actor Wendell Pierce, Metric performs live, wire walker Philippe Petit 12/30/15
item.description: The Wire actor Wendell Pierce on why art is essential in a crisis. Metric performs an intimate, stripped down set from their album Pagans in Vegas. Meet Philippe Petit, the real World Trade Center wire walker who inspired The Walk.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The Wire actor Wendell Pierce on why art is essential in a crisis. Metric performs an intimate, stripped down set from their album Pagans in Vegas. Meet Philippe Petit, the real World Trade Center wire walker who inspired The Walk.

item.title: Darryl "DMC" McDaniels, Margaret Atwood, investigative journalist Alfredo Corchado 12/29/15
item.description: Darryl "DMC" McDaniels brings rapid-fire storytelling to studio q. Canadian literary icon Margaret Atwood is back with believable dystopia. Hear investigative journalist Alfredo Corchado on getting death threats for doing his job in Mexico.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Darryl "DMC" McDaniels brings rapid-fire storytelling to studio q. Canadian literary icon Margaret Atwood is back with believable dystopia. Hear investigative journalist Alfredo Corchado on getting death threats for doing his job in Mexico.

item.title: Child Soldier author Michel Chikwanine, Sesame Street’s Sonia Manzano, Chrissie Hynde 12/28/15
item.description: Michel Chikwanine shares the personal story behind his book, Child Soldier. Hear Sonia Manzano on the challenging childhood that came before Sesame Street. Chrissie Hynde looks back in her memoir, Reckless: My Life as a Pretender.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca

item.title: Christmas special! DJ TLO, q pop culture panel, Jus Reign, Ronnie Hawkins and Gordon Lightfoot 12/24/2015
item.description: TLO mixes holiday classics and the biggest hits of 2015, the q pop culture panel looks back at the year that was, internet comic Jus Reign brings his Very Punjabi Christmas to studio q, Ronnie Hawkins and Gordon Lightfoot share their new Christmas collab.
